Package eg.edu.alexu.csd.datastructure.stack

Class ExpressionEvaluator

java.lang.Object
eg.edu.alexu.csd.datastructure.stack.ExpressionEvaluator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IExpressionEvaluator
public class ExpressionEvaluator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExpressionEvaluator
a class to implements methods required to convert infix to postfix expression and evaluating a postfix expression as well as handling invalid infix expressions

  • Method Details

    • infixToPostfix

      public java.lang.String infixToPostfix​(java.lang.String expression)
      Description copied from interface: IExpressionEvaluator
      Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to postfix notation. There is no assumption on spaces between terms or the length of the term (e.g., two digits symbolic or numeric term)
      Specified by:
      infixToPostfix in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - infix expression
      Returns:
      postfix expression

    • evaluate

      public int evaluate​(java.lang.String expression)
      Description copied from interface: IExpressionEvaluator
      Evaluate a postfix numeric expression, with a single space separator
      Specified by:
      evaluate in interface IExpressionEvaluator
      Parameters:
      expression - postfix expression
      Returns:
      the expression evaluated value

    • validInfix

      public java.lang.String validInfix​(java.lang.String exp)
      Takes a symbolic/numeric infix expression as input and converts it to infix expression with spaces between tokens
      Parameters:
      exp - infix expression string
      Returns:
      spaced infix expression or null if invalid

      public boolean validToken​(char ch)

      Parameters:

      ch - operator

    • isPrecedent

      public boolean isPrecedent​(char op, char opStack)
      takes operator and another operator stored in the stack checks the operator precedence
      Parameters:
      op - new operator
      opStack - operator stored in stack
      Returns:
      boolean value true if the operator has higher precedence than that in the stack false otherwise

      public int closingBracInd​(java.lang.String term)
      takes a string starting with a bracket searches for its closing bracket
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      index of the closing bracket or -1 if its closing bracket is not found
